title: 81岁山东村民植树二十载，无偿捐赠价值近百万红松树 - 山东 - 舜网新闻
text:
81岁山东村民植树二十载，无偿捐赠价值近百万红松树
央视新闻
在山东荣成市黄山王家村，有一片郁郁葱葱的红松树林，在这个植树节里，格外引人注目。
红松有“北国宝树”的美誉，主要分布在东北长白山到小兴安岭一带，可生长在东北的红松，为什么在荣成市得以繁育且成林成片呢?这得从村里的一位81岁老人——宋忠华说起。
记者找到宋忠华老人时，他正在红松林里忙活着。虽已年至耄耋，但精神矍铄，谈及与红松树的缘分，宋忠华打开了话匣子。1965年，他随母亲去吉林临江市生活，第一次看到红松，那高大挺拔的身姿一下子就印在了他的心里。
黄山王家村村民 宋忠华：我在东北住的地方满山都是红松，我觉得这个树非常好，一个是美化环境，净化空气，保持水土，最主要的结松子能供应美食，这个松子的营养价值高得很。
从2004年起，宋忠华回到家乡山东荣成市虎山镇黄山王家村，租赁了一片荒地，开始了漫长而艰辛的种树历程。他托朋友从吉林临江市寄来了约14万粒红松种子，满心期待着它们在家乡生根发芽。由于南北气温土壤条件差异大，红松树“水土不服”，第一年的成苗率仅有7%。面对这样的结果，宋忠华没有退缩。他买来专业书籍钻研学习，还四处向林业专家请教，终于摸索出一套自己的种植方法。
黄山王家村村民 宋忠华：选择河沟边的地，阴坡地，因为地温低，靠河沟的地还有水，这个水很凉，我早晨和晚上用水瓢往树上浇水，浇水能降地温，树慢慢大了以后，我就用草、麦秸和花生秆盖上它，能降地温保水，适合它生长。所以现在这些树都长得非常好，阴坡栽了5年了，今年是第6年，397棵5年就死3棵，基本上100%的成活率。
2013年，看着培育成功的红松茁壮成长，宋忠华有了新的想法，捐赠移栽红松树，让更多的红松树在家乡向上而生。
黄山王家村村民 宋忠华：骑着摩托车基本跑遍了威海地区，荣成、乳山、文登很多地方，最远去过招远，来回532公里，12年基本上超过10万公里。
宋忠华妻子 王秀珍：当初家里人都不支持他，都觉得他这么大年纪骑摩托车不安全，现在都支持他捐树都挺有意义的，都支持他，都拉他一把。
多年来，他累计无偿捐赠红松树4980棵，价值近百万元。如今，81岁的宋忠华依然忙碌在红松林间。
黄山王家村村民 宋忠华：只要能在我干得动的情况下，我继续捐下去，继续种下去，我想着在保护环境方面大家都行动起来，把这个树栽遍荣成，栽遍威海，栽遍山东，那是最理想的，我继续努力。

author: Germain Lussier
title: The New Battlestar Galactica Reboot Gets a Promising Update
text:
News of Mr. Robot creator Sam Esmail developing a new version of Battlestar Galactica broke almost five years ago . In that time, there haven’t been many updates , but now, finally, there’s a huge one and we’re hoping this is the news that pushes the project into reality.
Watch What’s Better Than One Screen? Asus Zenbook Duo Has Two
 Asus Says One Laptop Screen Is Good, but Two Is Even Better This QD-OLED Alienware Monitor is a Real Curveball Yesterday Will You Click Windows’ New Copilot Button? Friday 9:26AM
Deadline reports that the show, which is being developed for Peacock, will now be written, executive produced, and showrun by Derek Simonds. He created the 2017 USA show The Sinner starring Bill Pullman and produced that same year’s Call Me By Your Name . He’s taking over for Michael Lesslie, who was announced on the project in May 2020.
Advertisement Esmail remains on as an executive producer, so it seems like a good bet what he originally said way back in 2019 still holds true. At the time, Esmail said this version of Battlestar Galactica is not going to be a remake of the masterful 2004 series , or even the campy, delightful 1978 original. Instead, this will be a “new story within the mythology.” Or, at least that was the case almost five years ago. Maybe Simonds has a different take.
Advertisement Because, let’s face it, what’s Battlestar Galactica without... the good ship Battlestar Galactica , the last place where humanity survives in a galactic war with the evil Cylons.
Advertisement We’ll continue to keep you updated on any and all BSG happenings this year, next year, or even if it takes five more years for another update.

author: Voz de América
title: SIP alerta sobre amenazas del narcotráfico contra la prensa en Ecuador
text:
La Sociedad Interamericana de Prensa (SIP) alertó el jueves sobre
las amenazas del narcotráfico contra prensa en Ecuador.
Según
un comunicado de la organización, es preocupante "el avance de la violencia del crimen organizado" en el país "que buscar silenciar a la prensa", y cita las conversaciones difundidas por la Fiscalía General del Estado (FGE).
Según la revelación de la Fiscalía, el empresario prófugo de la justicia ecuatoriana Xavier Jordán y el abogado Helive Angulo –ahora en prisión preventiva– mantuvieron en 2022 conversaciones con el narcotraficante Leandro Norero, alias "El Patrón", quien se encontraba en prisión, de acuerdo con la prensa local.
En las conversaciones, Norero, asesinado en octubre del año pasado, "muestra incomodidad con la cobertura de la prensa, de acuerdo con los informes. En los mismos se discuten planes de seguimiento para "asustar" a periodistas del diario Expreso y de los canales Ecuavisa y Teleamazonas", señala la SIP.
Según la sociedad, los mensajes revelaron que el abogado del narcotraficante asesinado habría ofrecido información de un periodista de la ciudad de Manta, en la provincia de Manabí y propuesto a su cliente el secuestro del periodista Gerardo Delgado Olmedo, quien fue asesinado en Manta el 10 de agosto de 2022.
El presidente de la SIP, director de La Silla Rota, en México, Roberto Rock, dijo que "la revelación de amenazas contra periodistas y medios evidencia los peligros para el ejercicio del periodismo en Ecuador por parte del crimen organizado" y pidió que se "adopten medidas urgentes para frenar la creciente inseguridad y la acción del crimen organizado contra periodistas y medios que cubren temas sensibles".
El presidente de la Comisión de Libertad de Prensa e Información, Carlos Jornet, de La Voz del Interior, en Argentina, agregó que "el preocupante avance de grupos criminales agrava el clima de inseguridad y constituye una amenaza para la libertad de prensa y la democracia.
Las autoridades deben poner en marcha el mecanismo de protección para garantizar que periodistas y medios puedan trabajar sin temor a represalias".
Según la Fundación Periodistas Sin Cadenas (FPSC), entre enero y diciembre de 2023 se registraron 30 amenazas de muerte y nueve periodistas se vieron obligados a abandonar Ecuador.

author: Anthony Robledo
title: Viral photo of forlorn Spiral Hot Dogs owner leads to booming business
text: Customer's photo of forlorn owner in empty restaurant leads business to boom at OK diner Nick Chappell had never been to Spirals Hot Dogs & More before he took a photo of Scott Hosek in his empty restaurant. But after business boomed, Chappell's part of the Spirals family, Hosek says. [Anthony Robledo](https://www.usatoday.com/staff/7612431001/anthony-robledo/) An Oklahoma hot dog joint owner visibly wanted customers one day and he soon got more than he bargained for. During a slow shift on Dec. 20, a customer took a photo of Scott Hosek standing by his restaurant entrance waiting for diners and shared it on social media. Hosek would soon have no time to stand around as " [Spirals: Hot Dogs & More](https://spiralshotdogs.com/)," in Norman, Oklahoma, saw booming business once the post went viral. "We immediately started doing double digits in sales," Hosek told USA TODAY on Thursday. "It happened really fast to me." The day the photo was taken, Hosek found himself staring out the window upset his family business of four years wasn't booming as well as others ahead of Christmas. Hosek said he had no idea why Spirals saw a sudden wave of new customers after Dec. 20 until the person responsible for posting the photo, Nick Chappell, later apologized and offered to take the post down. Hosek wouldn't hear of it. "You just wouldn't expect it. Social media is amazing. It's amazing that people get involved with it," he said. "But more importantly, it's the stuff that you just don't think would work. That's what works." 'I will always love you': [See Dolly Parton grant Utah man's dying wish to meet her](/story/life/humankind/2023/12/26/dolly-parton-meets-longtime-fan/72033945007/) Customer knew he had to capture 'wholesome moment' Chappell visited the Norman area for his job as an Oklahoma Army National Guard. As part of their weekly hot dog Wednesday routine, Chappell and a his co-worker found Spirals on Google Maps and took a chance. Noticing Hosek gazing, Chappell decided to capture the "wholesome moment" on Snapchat captioning "He has been standing here waiting on customers to come in." "A good buddy of mine named Chad said, 'Hey, man, you can either post this on Facebook or I'm going to post this on Facebook. Some way or another we're going to get this guy some customers,'" Chappell said. In a Facebook post, Chappell gave an excellent recommendation of the restaurant, complimenting their food and "off the charts" service. He shared a photo of his dish, the menu and of Hosek waiting for diners. Chappell was blown away by the success of the post, which has since had over 2,000 shares, and even more surprised to see over 70 guests at the diner during his next visit. "I'm not a huge social media guy I typically don't share," Chappell said. "I don't even know really the words to describe it as but it made me even that much happier that I did make a post." Owner adds new 'Thunderbird' item in customer's honor Hosek is showing his gratitude by adding a new item in Chappell's honor. Having named hot dogs and bowls after family members, he was more than happy to do so. The "Thunderbird" is a hot link with bacon, cream cheese and jalapeños, Hosek said. The meal gets its name from the Thunderbird Unit Patch for the 45th Infantry, which Chappell is a part of. The two reconnected at the restaurant on Thursday, where they both got emotional talking about the post's impact. Chappell received a certificate of appreciation during the unveiling of the "Thunderbird" and was told he is now forever part of the Spirals family. "To know that it was a humble guy that just saw our need and did what he could. He doesn’t have a real following on social media, he hardly ever shares anything and to know that one post had so much power. It was super cool," Hosek added.
